comments:
When the framework console is created it may be passed an array of initial commands to run.  This will cause the following exception to occur.

Exception in thread "OSGi Console" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.lang.Throwable.printStackTrace(Throwable.java:252)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandInterpreter.printStackTrace(FrameworkCommandInterpreter.java:258)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandInterpreter.execute(FrameworkCommandInterpreter.java:151)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.docommand(FrameworkConsole.java:291)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:240)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.run(FrameworkConsole.java:208)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)

The cause of this is because the streams have not been initialized before the initial commands are run in the console.  This is a regression from 3.2 which looks to have been introduced by the fix to bug 122911.

Created an attachment (id=74167)
3.3.1 and 3.4 fix

This patch ensures that getDefaultStreams is called before running the initial commands.
Fix released to both 3.3.1 and HEAD (3.4).
